segment.source: This article describes how to use the SceneAnalysisEffect and the FaceDetectionEffect to analyze the content of the media capture preview stream.
segment.target: This article describes how to use the SceneAnalysisEffect and the FaceDetectionEffect to analyze the content of the media capture preview stream.

segment.source: Scene analysis for media capture
segment.target: Scene analysis for media capture

segment.source: Scene analysis for media capture
segment.target: Scene analysis for media capture

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: This article describes how to use the SceneAnalysisEffect and the FaceDetectionEffect to analyze the content of the media capture preview stream.
segment.target: This article describes how to use the SceneAnalysisEffect and the FaceDetectionEffect to analyze the content of the media capture preview stream.

segment.source: Scene analysis effect
segment.target: Scene analysis effect

segment.source: The SceneAnalysisEffect analyzes the video frames in the media capture preview stream and recommends processing options to improve the capture result.
segment.target: The SceneAnalysisEffect analyzes the video frames in the media capture preview stream and recommends processing options to improve the capture result.

segment.source: Currently, the effect supports detecting whether the capture would be improved by using High Dynamic Range (HDR) processing.
segment.target: Currently, the effect supports detecting whether the capture would be improved by using High Dynamic Range (HDR) processing.

segment.source: If the effect recommends using HDR, you can do this in the following ways:
segment.target: If the effect recommends using HDR, you can do this in the following ways:

segment.source: Use the AdvancedPhotoCapture class to capture photos using the Windows built-in HDR processing algorithm.
segment.target: Use the AdvancedPhotoCapture class to capture photos using the Windows built-in HDR processing algorithm.

segment.source: For more information, see High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture.
segment.target: For more information, see High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture.

segment.source: Use the HdrVideoControl to capture video using the Windows built-in HDR processing algorithm.
segment.target: Use the HdrVideoControl to capture video using the Windows built-in HDR processing algorithm.

segment.source: For more information, see Capture device controls for video capture.
segment.target: For more information, see Capture device controls for video capture.

segment.source: Use the VariablePhotoSequenceControl to capture a sequence of frames that you can then composite using a custom HDR implementation.
segment.target: Use the VariablePhotoSequenceControl to capture a sequence of frames that you can then composite using a custom HDR implementation.

segment.source: For more information, see Variable photo sequence.
segment.target: For more information, see Variable photo sequence.

segment.source: Scene analysis namespaces
segment.target: Scene analysis namespaces

segment.source: To use scene analysis, your app must include the following namespaces in addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture.
segment.target: To use scene analysis, your app must include the following namespaces in addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture.

segment.source: SceneAnalysisUsing
segment.target: SceneAnalysisUsing

segment.source: Initialize the scene analysis effect and add it to the preview stream
segment.target: Initialize the scene analysis effect and add it to the preview stream

segment.source: Video effects are implemented using two APIs, an effect definition, which provides settings that the capture device needs to initialize the effect, and an effect instance, which can be used to control the effect.
segment.target: Video effects are implemented using two APIs, an effect definition, which provides settings that the capture device needs to initialize the effect, and an effect instance, which can be used to control the effect.

segment.source: Since you may want to access the effect instance from multiple places within your code, you should typically declare a member variable to hold the object.
segment.target: Since you may want to access the effect instance from multiple places within your code, you should typically declare a member variable to hold the object.

segment.source: DeclareSceneAnalysisEffect
segment.target: DeclareSceneAnalysisEffect

segment.source: In your app, after you have initialized the MediaCapture object, create a new instance of SceneAnalysisEffectDefinition.
segment.target: In your app, after you have initialized the MediaCapture object, create a new instance of SceneAnalysisEffectDefinition.

segment.source: Register the effect with the capture device by calling AddVideoEffectAsync on your MediaCapture object, providing the SceneAnalysisEffectDefinition and specifying MediaStreamType.VideoPreview to indicate that the effect should be applied to the video preview stream, as opposed to the capture stream.
segment.target: Register the effect with the capture device by calling AddVideoEffectAsync on your MediaCapture object, providing the SceneAnalysisEffectDefinition and specifying MediaStreamType.VideoPreview to indicate that the effect should be applied to the video preview stream, as opposed to the capture stream.

segment.source: AddVideoEffectAsync returns an instance of the added effect.
segment.target: AddVideoEffectAsync returns an instance of the added effect.

segment.source: Because this method can be used with multiple effect types, you must cast the returned instance to a SceneAnalysisEffect object.
segment.target: Because this method can be used with multiple effect types, you must cast the returned instance to a SceneAnalysisEffect object.

segment.source: To receive the results of the scene analysis, you must register a handler for the SceneAnalyzed event.
segment.target: To receive the results of the scene analysis, you must register a handler for the SceneAnalyzed event.

segment.source: Currently, the scene analysis effect only includes the high dynamic range analyzer.
segment.target: Currently, the scene analysis effect only includes the high dynamic range analyzer.

segment.source: Enable HDR analysis by setting the effect's HighDynamicRangeControl.Enabled to true.
segment.target: Enable HDR analysis by setting the effect's HighDynamicRangeControl.Enabled to true.

segment.source: CreateSceneAnalysisEffectAsync
segment.target: CreateSceneAnalysisEffectAsync

segment.source: Implement the SceneAnalyzed event handler
segment.target: Implement the SceneAnalyzed event handler

segment.source: The results of the scene analysis are returned in the SceneAnalyzed event handler.
segment.target: The results of the scene analysis are returned in the SceneAnalyzed event handler.

segment.source: The SceneAnalyzedEventArgs object passed into the handler has a SceneAnalysisEffectFrame object which has a HighDynamicRangeOutput object.
segment.target: The SceneAnalyzedEventArgs object passed into the handler has a SceneAnalysisEffectFrame object which has a HighDynamicRangeOutput object.

segment.source: The Certainty property of the high dynamic range output provides a value between 0 and 1.0 where 0 indicates that HDR processing would not help improve the capture result and 1.0 indicates that HDR processing would help.
segment.target: The Certainty property of the high dynamic range output provides a value between 0 and 1.0 where 0 indicates that HDR processing would not help improve the capture result and 1.0 indicates that HDR processing would help.

segment.source: Your can decide the threshold point at which you want to use HDR or show the results to the user and let the user decide.
segment.target: Your can decide the threshold point at which you want to use HDR or show the results to the user and let the user decide.

segment.source: SceneAnalyzed
segment.target: SceneAnalyzed

segment.source: The HighDynamicRangeOutput object passed into the handler also has a FrameControllers property which contains suggested frame controllers for capturing a variable photo sequence for HDR processing.
segment.target: The HighDynamicRangeOutput object passed into the handler also has a FrameControllers property which contains suggested frame controllers for capturing a variable photo sequence for HDR processing.

segment.source: For more information, see Variable photo sequence.
segment.target: For more information, see Variable photo sequence.

segment.source: Clean up the scene analysis effect
segment.target: Clean up the scene analysis effect

segment.source: When your app is done capturing, before disposing of the MediaCapture object, you should disable the scene analysis effect by setting the effect's HighDynamicRangeAnalyzer.Enabled property to false and unregister your SceneAnalyzed event handler.
segment.target: When your app is done capturing, before disposing of the MediaCapture object, you should disable the scene analysis effect by setting the effect's HighDynamicRangeAnalyzer.Enabled property to false and unregister your SceneAnalyzed event handler.

segment.source: Call MediaCapture.ClearEffectsAsync, specifying the video preview stream since that was the stream to which the effect was added.
segment.target: Call MediaCapture.ClearEffectsAsync, specifying the video preview stream since that was the stream to which the effect was added.

segment.source: Finally, set your member variable to null.
segment.target: Finally, set your member variable to null.

segment.source: CleanUpSceneAnalysisEffectAsync
segment.target: CleanUpSceneAnalysisEffectAsync

segment.source: Face detection effect
segment.target: Face detection effect

segment.source: The FaceDetectionEffect identifies the location of faces within the media capture preview stream.
segment.target: The FaceDetectionEffect identifies the location of faces within the media capture preview stream.

segment.source: The effect allows you to receive a notification whenever a face is detected in the preview stream and provides the bounding box for each detected face within the preview frame.
segment.target: The effect allows you to receive a notification whenever a face is detected in the preview stream and provides the bounding box for each detected face within the preview frame.

segment.source: On supported devices, the face detection effect also provides enhanced exposure and focus on the most important face in the scene.
segment.target: On supported devices, the face detection effect also provides enhanced exposure and focus on the most important face in the scene.

segment.source: Face detection namespaces
segment.target: Face detection namespaces

segment.source: To use face detection, your app must include the following namespaces in addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture.
segment.target: To use face detection, your app must include the following namespaces in addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture.

segment.source: FaceDetectionUsing
segment.target: FaceDetectionUsing

segment.source: Initialize the face detection effect and add it to the preview stream
segment.target: Initialize the face detection effect and add it to the preview stream

segment.source: Video effects are implemented using two APIs, an effect definition, which provides settings that the capture device needs to initialize the effect, and an effect instance, which can be used to control the effect.
segment.target: Video effects are implemented using two APIs, an effect definition, which provides settings that the capture device needs to initialize the effect, and an effect instance, which can be used to control the effect.

segment.source: Since you may want to access the effect instance from multiple places within your code, you should typically declare a member variable to hold the object.
segment.target: Since you may want to access the effect instance from multiple places within your code, you should typically declare a member variable to hold the object.

segment.source: DeclareFaceDetectionEffect
segment.target: DeclareFaceDetectionEffect

segment.source: In your app, after you have initialized the MediaCapture object, create a new instance of FaceDetectionEffectDefinition.
segment.target: In your app, after you have initialized the MediaCapture object, create a new instance of FaceDetectionEffectDefinition.

segment.source: Set the DetectionMode property to prioritize faster face detection or more accurate face detection.
segment.target: Set the DetectionMode property to prioritize faster face detection or more accurate face detection.

segment.source: Set SynchronousDetectionEnabled to specify that incoming frames are not delayed waiting for face detection to complete as this can result in a choppy preview experience.
segment.target: Set SynchronousDetectionEnabled to specify that incoming frames are not delayed waiting for face detection to complete as this can result in a choppy preview experience.

segment.source: Register the effect with the capture device by calling AddVideoEffectAsync on your MediaCapture object, providing the FaceDetectionEffectDefinition and specifying MediaStreamType.VideoPreview to indicate that the effect should be applied to the video preview stream, as opposed to the capture stream.
segment.target: Register the effect with the capture device by calling AddVideoEffectAsync on your MediaCapture object, providing the FaceDetectionEffectDefinition and specifying MediaStreamType.VideoPreview to indicate that the effect should be applied to the video preview stream, as opposed to the capture stream.

segment.source: AddVideoEffectAsync returns an instance of the added effect.
segment.target: AddVideoEffectAsync returns an instance of the added effect.

segment.source: Because this method can be used with multiple effect types, you must cast the returned instance to a FaceDetectionEffect object.
segment.target: Because this method can be used with multiple effect types, you must cast the returned instance to a FaceDetectionEffect object.

segment.source: Enable or disable the effect by setting the FaceDetectionEffect.Enabled property.
segment.target: Enable or disable the effect by setting the FaceDetectionEffect.Enabled property.

segment.source: Adjust how often the effect analyzes frames by setting the FaceDetectionEffect.DesiredDetectionInterval property.
segment.target: Adjust how often the effect analyzes frames by setting the FaceDetectionEffect.DesiredDetectionInterval property.

segment.source: Both of these properties can be adjusted while media capture is ongoing.
segment.target: Both of these properties can be adjusted while media capture is ongoing.

segment.source: CreateFaceDetectionEffectAsync
segment.target: CreateFaceDetectionEffectAsync

segment.source: Receive notifications when faces are detected
segment.target: Receive notifications when faces are detected

segment.source: If you want to perform some action when faces are detected, such as drawing a box around detected faces in the video preview, you can register for the FaceDetected event.
segment.target: If you want to perform some action when faces are detected, such as drawing a box around detected faces in the video preview, you can register for the FaceDetected event.

segment.source: RegisterFaceDetectionHandler
segment.target: RegisterFaceDetectionHandler

segment.source: In the handler for the event, you can get a list of all faces detected in a frame by accessing the FaceDetectionEffectFrame.DetectedFaces property of the FaceDetectedEventArgs.
segment.target: In the handler for the event, you can get a list of all faces detected in a frame by accessing the FaceDetectionEffectFrame.DetectedFaces property of the FaceDetectedEventArgs.

segment.source: The FaceBox property is a BitmapBounds structure that describes the rectangle containing the detected face in units relative to the preview stream dimensions.
segment.target: The FaceBox property is a BitmapBounds structure that describes the rectangle containing the detected face in units relative to the preview stream dimensions.

segment.source: To view sample code that transforms the preview stream coordinates into screen coordinates, see the face detection UWP sample.
segment.target: To view sample code that transforms the preview stream coordinates into screen coordinates, see the face detection UWP sample.

segment.source: FaceDetected
segment.target: FaceDetected

segment.source: Clean up the face detection effect
segment.target: Clean up the face detection effect

segment.source: When your app is done capturing, before disposing of the MediaCapture object, you should disable the face detection effect with FaceDetectionEffect.Enabled and unregister your FaceDetected event handler if you previously registered one.
segment.target: When your app is done capturing, before disposing of the MediaCapture object, you should disable the face detection effect with FaceDetectionEffect.Enabled and unregister your FaceDetected event handler if you previously registered one.

segment.source: Call MediaCapture.ClearEffectsAsync, specifying the video preview stream since that was the stream to which the effect was added.
segment.target: Call MediaCapture.ClearEffectsAsync, specifying the video preview stream since that was the stream to which the effect was added.

segment.source: Finally, set your member variable to null.
segment.target: Finally, set your member variable to null.

segment.source: CleanUpFaceDetectionEffectAsync
segment.target: CleanUpFaceDetectionEffectAsync

segment.source: Check for focus and exposure support for detected faces
segment.target: Check for focus and exposure support for detected faces

segment.source: Not all devices have a capture device that can adjust its focus and exposure based on detected faces.
segment.target: Not all devices have a capture device that can adjust its focus and exposure based on detected faces.

segment.source: Because face detection consumes device resources, you may only want to enable face detection on devices that can use the feature to enhance capture.
segment.target: Because face detection consumes device resources, you may only want to enable face detection on devices that can use the feature to enhance capture.

segment.source: To see if face-based capture optimization is available, get the VideoDeviceController for your initialized MediaCapture and then get the video device controller's RegionsOfInterestControl.
segment.target: To see if face-based capture optimization is available, get the VideoDeviceController for your initialized MediaCapture and then get the video device controller's RegionsOfInterestControl.

segment.source: Check to see if the MaxRegions supports at least one region.
segment.target: Check to see if the MaxRegions supports at least one region.

segment.source: Then check to see if either AutoExposureSupported or AutoFocusSupported are true.
segment.target: Then check to see if either AutoExposureSupported or AutoFocusSupported are true.

segment.source: If these conditions are met, then the device can take advantage of face detection to enhance capture.
segment.target: If these conditions are met, then the device can take advantage of face detection to enhance capture.

segment.source: AreFaceFocusAndExposureSupported
segment.target: AreFaceFocusAndExposureSupported
